metalign.parsing

Class KernEventParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.parsing.KernEventParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventParser

    public class KernEventParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventParser
    A KernEventParser parses notes in from a kern file.
    One KernEventParser is required per kern file.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 5 Sept, 2016

    • Field Detail

      • WHOLE_NOTE_DURATION_TICKS

        public static final int WHOLE_NOTE_DURATION_TICKS
        The duration of a whole note, in ticks.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • noteDurationPattern

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern noteDurationPattern
        A Regex pattern to grab a note duration from a **kern file.
        Group 1 will be the number duration, and group 2 will be any dots.

      • notePitchPattern

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern notePitchPattern
        A Regex pattern to grab a note pitch from a **kern file.
        Group 1 will be the pitch, and group 2 will be the accidentals.

      • timeTracker

        private TimeTracker timeTracker
        The TimeTracker which will handle timing information for this song.

      • noteEventParser

        private final NoteEventParser noteEventParser
        The NoteTracker which will keep track of the notes for this song.

      • song

        private final java.io.File song
        The song we are parsing.

      • goldStandard

        private java.util.List<java.util.List<MidiNote>> goldStandard
        The gold standard voices from this song.

      • firstNoteTime

        private long firstNoteTime
        The first note time.

      • KernEventParser

        public KernEventParser(java.io.File kernFile,
                       NoteEventParser noteEventParser,
                       TimeTracker timeTracker)
        Creates a new KernEventParser
        Parameters:
        kernFile - The kern file we will parse.
        noteEventParser - The NoteEventParser to pass events to when we run this parser.
        timeTracker - timeTracker

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                java.io.IOException
        Parse the loaded file to the loaded NoteEventParser.
        Specified by:
        run in interface EventParser
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If this is running on a GUI and gets cancelled.
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred while reading the file.

      • getDuration

        private int getDuration(java.lang.String voice,
                        int lineNum)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Get the duration, in ticks, of the given note or rest marker.
        Parameters:
        voice - A note or rest marker.
        lineNum - The line number the note or rest marker came from.
        Returns:
        The duration of the given marker in ticks.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If no duration is found.

      • getDuration

        private int getDuration(int length,
                        int dotCount,
                        int lineNum)
        Get the length in ticks of a note or rest with the given value and dots.
        Parameters:
        length - The value of the note, in **kern format. 1 = whole note, 2 = half note, etc.
        dotCount - The number of dots after the note.
        lineNum - The line number this duration was found on.
        Returns:
        The length of the note in ticks.

      • getPitch

        private int getPitch(java.lang.String voice,
                     int lineNum)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Get the pitch of the given note or rest marker. A rest will return -1.
        Parameters:
        voice - A note or rest marker.
        lineNum - The line number the note or rest marker came from.
        Returns:
        The pitch of the given note, or -1 if it is a rest.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If no rest or pitch is found.

      • getPitch

        private int getPitch(java.lang.String pitch)
        Get the pitch number of the given note data.
        Parameters:
        pitch - The **kern pitch String.
        Returns:
        The pitch number, where 60 is C4.

      • handleIndicator

        private void handleIndicator(java.lang.String indicator,
                             int lineNum)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Handle the given indicator read from the **kern file.
        Parameters:
        indicator - The indicator we need to parse.
        lineNum - The line number the indicator came from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some error occurred in parsing the indicator.

      • getOffsetAboveCFromChar

        private int getOffsetAboveCFromChar(char pitch)
        Get the offset (in semitones) above C of the given pitch.
        Parameters:
        pitch - The pitch character we want the offset above C for.
        Returns:
        The offset above C of the given pitch character, or -1 if invalid.
